Administer the vaccine via intramuscular injection:
	* Use a clean needle and syringe 
	* Inject the vaccine into the deltoid muscle (middle outer aspect of the upper arm)
	* Insert the needle at a 90-degree angle to the skin 
	* Push the plunger slowly and steadily

Administer the vaccine:
	* Choose an appropriate injection site (deltoid muscle, usually upper arm):
		+ For adults: approximately 2-3 inches below acromion process 
		+ For children: approximately 1-2 inches below shoulder joint 
	* Clean the injection site with an alcohol wipe 
	* Hold the syringe at a 90-degree angle, injecting the vaccine intramuscularly (IM) 
	* Inject the recommended dose (0.5 mL for most flu vaccines)
